benchmark_details.name: DRIVING VQA
benchmark_details.overview: DRIVING VQA is a visual question answering dataset derived from driving theory exams, containing 3,931 multiple-choice problems with expert-written explanations and grounded entities relevant to the reasoning process.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To benchmark and enhance the visual reasoning capabilities of vision-language models in real-world driving scenarios.

data.source: Derived from publicly available French driving theory exams.
data.annotation: Expert-written explanations and human annotations of relevant entities with bounding box coordinates.

methodology.calculation: Performance is measured with the exam score, analogous to the real driving theory score used to evaluate candidates.
methodology.interpretation: A higher score indicates better performance in correctly answering questions based on visual reasoning.
methodology.validation: Inter-annotator agreement achieved a score of 0.95.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All data used is derived from publicly available sources and anonymization measures are employed during the data collection process.
